cooking_method: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices. Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and cashew nuts. Add chicken and cook until tender.
Sauté tomatoes, turmeric powder, and curry leaves. Add prawns and coconut milk. Simmer until prawns are cooked.
Sauté onions and spices. Add mixed vegetables and rice. Cook until rice is fluffy and vegetables are tender.
Marinate mutton in yogurt and spices. Sauté onion paste and cashew nuts. Add mutton and cook until tender. Garnish with saffron strands.
Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and turmeric powder. Add prawns and coconut milk. Simmer until prawns are cooked.
Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. Add beef and tomatoes. Cook until beef is tender and the mixture thickens.
Grind mustard seeds and green chilies. Marinate fish with turmeric and salt. Fry fish in mustard oil, add mustard paste, and cook until the sauce thickens.
Grind poppy seeds and green chilies. Sauté potatoes, add the poppy seed paste, turmeric powder, and cook until the potatoes are tender.
Boil minced meat and chickpeas. Grind with onions, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. Shape into patties and shallow fry.
Sauté onions and cumin seeds. Add rice, lentils, and water. Cook until the khichuri reaches a soupy consistency.
Grind mustard seeds and green chilies. Marinate hilsa fish with turmeric and salt. Fry fish in mustard oil, add mustard paste, and cook until the sauce thickens.
Sauté onions and spices. Add mutton and cook until tender. Layer cooked rice and mutton, and steam until the flavors meld together.
Prepare a batter with rice flour, coconut, jaggery, and cardamom powder. Steam the batter in banana leaves until cooked.
Reduce milk and mix with yogurt, sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron strands. Set aside to ferment and sweeten.
Sauté potatoes, tomatoes, green chilies, and turmeric powder. Add rohu fish and water. Simmer until the fish is cooked and the gravy thickens.
Sauté onions, ginger-garlic paste, and spices. Add mutton and tomatoes. Cook until mutton is tender and the gravy thickens.
Boil Bengal gram and grind with chitol fish, ginger, and cumin powder. Shape into dumplings and fry until golden brown. Serve with mustard oil drizzle.
Prepare a dough with rice flour and water. Stuff with jaggery, coconut, and cardamom powder. Shape into dumplings or pancakes and cook on a griddle. Garnish with sesame seeds.
